item.title: John Carmack UMKC Commencement Speech
item.description: “There are lots of viable paths through engineering. The path I advocate for is ‘knowledge in depth’ - for knowing things really deeply. It’s true that the modern wizardry of building amazing applications by bashing together a bunch of JavaScript libraries and web services has indeed minted a lot of startup millionaires, but it does remind me of Mickey Mouse as the sorcerer’s apprentice in Fantasia animating broomsticks with magic he doesn’t really understand and eventually making a really big mess.
